data.title: 100 Great Affordable Art Schools for an Undergraduate Degree
data.meta_description: A ranking of the best affordable art schools for getting an art degree. Ranked by affordability and quality.
data.text:
Are you a creative type but want to avoid going the “starving artist” route? The answer to your dilemma may be found in an undergraduate art program. Associate’s degrees in art do exist and can be an option for some students. However, most serious art students eventually decide to pursue a bachelor’s degree program in the discipline. These four-year degree programs are often available through designated art schools or liberal arts universities. Students considering an undergraduate art degree can expect to study on campus for the most part. Though online and hybrid art programs are available, they represent the exception rather than the rule. Since hands-on learning makes up the core of these programs, they are hard to replicate in a virtual environment.

In this ranking, we explore the 100 best colleges for art majors at the undergraduate level.

Rating and Ranking Methodology

Tuition

Net Price Below $5,000: 5 points

Net Price Below $10,000: 4 points

Net Price Below $15,000: 3 points

Net Price Below $20,500: 2 points

Net Price Below $25,000: 1 point

Student to Faculty Ratio

Less than 20:1: 1 point

Less than 15: 1: 2 points

Less than 10: 1: 3 points

Graduate Degree Opportunities in Art

Presence of Master’s Degree Program – 1 point

Presence of Doctoral Degree Program – 1 point

20-Year Net ROI

Above $600,000 – 5 points

Above $500,000 – 4 points

Above $400,000 –3 points

Above $300,000 – 2 points

Above $200,000 –1 point

Accreditation (School-Wide and Program-Specific) – 1 point per item

Student Support Services for Art Students—1 point each

Wow Factor: awarded for each unique feature or program that “wowed” us – 1 point

Ranking the Top Colleges for Bachelor’s Degrees in Art

To create this ranking of the 100 top schools for art, our editors gathered an initial list of 115 colleges offering undergraduate art degrees for less than $25,000 per year in tuition costs. We then applied a return-on-investment filter, eliminating schools with ROIs of less than $100,000. Finally, we applied the rating and ranking methodology above. In the case of a tie, we awarded the more affordable school the higher ranking.
